quest.name: Safekeeping
journal: Cyella appears surprised─though not displeased─to see you.

Cyella mentions she had been concerned that you had gone back to the Source for good, taking the crystals belonging to the First's Warriors of Light with you. She asks that you consider entrusting said crystals to her, that they might remain in the world those heroes fought so desperately to protect. As this is not a decision to be made lightly, you resolve to seek the input of their spiritual successors─the bounty hunters who helped to defeat the Cardinal Virtues─before committing.

Giott is but a few steps away, indulging in her usual alcohol-related pastime, so you begin by asking for her input. She appears equal parts intimidated by the idea of deciding the fate of Lamitt's crystal and excited for the opportunity to make Lue-Reeq pay for her drinks, and so dashes off to collect him and Granson while you speak to Cerigg and Taynor.

The group of bounty hunters assembled, you explain both Cyella's history and the possible reasons for entrusting her with the crystals. Though they are understandably surprised to hear that the erstwhile Shadowkeeper is nearby pouring ale, all agree that what remains of the First's Warriors of Light should remain in Norvrandt─and proceed to get astoundingly drunk. In the aftermath, you follow through on their sentiments by turning over the crystals to Cyella, who is moved to find that her former companions considered her a friend to the end, one and all.
You find Cyella again once she has had a bit more time to process her emotions. She vows that she will continue to speak the truth of the Warriors of Light, so that their legacy may live on.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: If it isn't Forename, loitering about the Stairs just like any old eveningday.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: And here I was worried that you'd gone back to your world for good, and I was too late.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: It's just that I've been thinking about the crystals belonging to the Warriors of Light.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: I hear they ended up with you, after you lot defeated the Virtues. I assume you have Ardbert's as well?

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Indeed─that does seem appropriate. His bond with Seto is deep and enduring.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: As for the others...I had hoped you might be persuaded to leave them in my care.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: It was only right that they, like Ardbert, should accompany you on your journey to set this world back on its proper course.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Yet you now have a home you must return to, while the First is theirs. After all they did to keep it safe, they deserve to be here to see what its future holds.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Oh, don't make that face. I know it's a big decision, but it needn't fall entirely to you. There are others here who care for the Warriors of Light as much as you do, aren't there?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: <gulp> <gulp> <gulp> Ahhh...

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Now that's some damn fine ale! How many should I order for you? I know you ain't much of a drinker, so... Six? Seven?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: What? You want help deciding the fate of Lamitt's crystal? And the others too? ...Does this place have any bigger tankards?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Well, if you insist... Lue-Reeq owes me drinks─plural─so I'll make sure he joins us. Maybe find Granson while I'm at it.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: You go on and wait with Cerigg and Taynor. Order a round while I'm out, you hear?

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: You see why I work here. Folk are always in reach when I need them.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Good to see you, Forename. What did you say that has Giott so worked up?

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: The crystals, eh? That does sound like a conversation worth getting everyone together for.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Did Lue-Reeq really promise to pay for Giott's drinks? That's a disaster in the making...

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Not just hers─rounds for the lot of us! Might be that the lad yet has a few things to learn about coin and the scarcity thereof.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Still, I'll not turn down his generosity. Go and tell the barkeep we'll be needing food and ale for the table.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Fine... But please try to exercise some restraint. I'll not carry you back to the room again.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Here we are! How much of a head start did you get? Should I ask 'em to bring out the cask?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: I reckon we should hear Forename out first.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: So...you're telling me that the barmaid was one of Nyelbert's companions, not to mention the Shadowkeeper? And from a different world? That's laying it on a bit thick.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: It certainly raises questions.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Quite! Such as how she retains her youthful visage...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Not that.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: ...I had my suspicions about her. The other night I was at the counter─quaffing my ale, having a grand time─and next I realize, I'm outside without a gil to my name. And it ain't the first time!

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: It could only be the power of the Shadowkeeper...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: ...And not that you drink enough to fell a small army.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: If Forename says it's true, I'm inclined to believe it. Which leaves us with the matter of entrusting the crystals to her.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: She's right that this was Branden's home─the others', too. And it's home to their most important memories. Not all of them good, maybe, but...everyone they loved is laid to rest here.

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: I agree. Nyelbert belongs here.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Ardbert's crystal is with Seto, in this world. Lamitt would want to be near.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Renda-Rae as well, I think. She'd want to be with her friends, in the place that she loved.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: It seems we all agree.

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: A toast, then! To the Warriors of Light!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: (-Hunters-)To the Warriors of Light!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Drink up! I'm paying, and as bounty hunters, I expect you all to take proper advantage of that.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: I hate to disappoint, but I'm not much for alcohol. This juice looks nice, though...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Ah, that's not─

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: How did you manage this? Twice the mess in half the time as normal patrons, I swear.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: I overheard your conversation, by the way. Do you agree with your friends?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: These crystals are yours...storykeeper.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: They would know best.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Their legacies are safe with me, you have my word.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: I'll be certain not to disappoint them.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: I can feel them... Their memories...

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Why? Why, dammit!?

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: You're all just like Ardbert. I betrayed you, I manipulated you, and still...

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: You thought of me as a comrade─a friend─until the very end.

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: Giott seems excited. Should I be concerned?

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: We've finally managed to clean up after you lot...for the most part. Perhaps next time we should set down a tarpaulin.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, I'm grateful to you for entrusting these to me. And as long as I live, I will never stop sharing the true tale of the Warriors of Light─of my friends.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The quest “The Hero's Journey” will now be made available.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept it, you must have completed the Chronicles of a New Era quests “Thok Around the Clock,” “The Diabolical Bismarck,” “A Fiendish Likeness,” “A Deific Simulacrum,” and “A Demonic Duplicate.”

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: This...<heave> This is why I don't drink...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: A week's worth of earnings! How is this possible?

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: Whew! Can't remember the last time I was so drunk. ...Or any of the other times, neither, but that ain't important. A successful sousing calls for a celebratory ale!

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: My head...

dialogue.name: TAYNOR
dialogue.text: I did warn you...
